gurmukhi: imil dyv Adyvn isMD mQXo ] kb sXwm kiv`qn m`D kQXo ]
transliteration: Mil(i) Dev Adevan Sindh Mathyo|| Kab Syaam Kavittan Maddh Kathyo||
translation: Both the gods and demons unitedly churned the ocean, which hath been narrated in verse by the poet Shyam.

gurmukhi: qb rqn cqur ds XoN inksy ] Asqw ins mo ss sy ibgsy ]1]
transliteration: Tab Ratan Chatur Das Yon Nikse|| Astaa Nis Mo Sas Se Bigse||1||
translation: Then the fourteen jewels, in their splendour emanated from the sea, just as the moon looks elegant during the night.1.

gurmukhi: AmrwNqk sIs kI Er hUAM ] imil pUC ghI ids dyv dUAM ]
transliteration: Amraantak Sees Kior Hoong|| Mil(i) Pooch Gadidis Dev Dooan||
translation: The demons caught Vasuki from the side of the head and the gods from the side of the tail.

gurmukhi: rqnM inksy ibgsy sis sy ] jnu GUtn lyq AmI rs ky ]2]
transliteration: Ratanan Nikse Bigse Sas(i) Se|| Jan(u) Ghootan Let Amiras Ke||2||
translation: On seeing the jewels emanating from the sea, they became pleased as though they had drunk the ambrosia.2.

gurmukhi: inksXo Dnu swiek su`D isqM ] mdy pwn kFXo Gt mdX mqM ]
transliteration: Niksyo Dhan(u) Saaik Suddh Sitan|| Made Paan Kadhyo Ghat Madya Matan||
translation: The bow and of purely white colour came out, and those intoxicated ones brought out from the ocean a pitcher of honey.

gurmukhi: gj bwj suDw lCmI inksI ] Gn mo mno ib`dulqw ibgsI ]3]
transliteration: Gadj Baaj Sudhaa Lachhminiksee|| Ghan Mo Mano Biddultaa Bigsee||3||
translation: The elephant, horse, nectar and Lakshmi came out and looked splendid like the flash of lightning from the clouds.3.

gurmukhi: klpwdRum mwhur Aau rMBw ] ijh moih rhY lK ieMdR sBw ]
transliteration: Kalapaadroum Maahur Au Ranbhaa|| Jih Moh(i) Rahai Lakh Indraa Sabhaa||
translation: After Kalapdrum (Elysian, wish-fulfilling tree) and poison, the heavenly damsel Rambha came out, seeing whom, the people of Indrsâ€™s court allured.

gurmukhi: mix kOsqkM sis rUp suBM ] ijh B`jq dYq iblok juDM ]4]
transliteration: Man(i) Kaoustakan Sas(i) Roop Soubhan|| Jih Bhajjat Dait Bilok Judhan||4||
translation: The Kaustubh jewel and the moon also came out, which are remembered by the demons in the battlefield.4.

gurmukhi: inksI gvrwj su Dyn BlI ] ijh CIn lXo shswsqR blI ]
transliteration: Niksigadraaj Su Dhen Bhalee|| Jih Chheen Layo Sahsaastra Balee||
translation: Kamadhenu (the wish-fulfilling cow) also came out which was seized by the mighty Sahasrajun.
